oai_dc:dc.dc:title: RESPONSE OF MOORED VESSELS IN BTJFFINGTON HARBOUR
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mansard, E.P.D.
Faure, T.
MacIntosh, K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: moored vessel
harbor
Buffington Harbor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In a temporary facility built within Buffington Harbour, it was proposed to operate two floating vessels as casinos. An extensive program of physical and numerical model investigations was undertaken to design a harbour and mooring layout that would ensure effective operation with minimal downtime for casino operations. Through a sophisticated model testing program, the motions of the floating vessels were established for different sea states. These motions were then used as inputs to a ship simulator where client representatives participated in the full scale simulations in order to select the sea states that would cause discomfort to clients.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
